gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GT10 - HeNe_dups from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Helium and Neon duplicates from station 1 of KN199-04 (GT10) cruise. Dataset Description: <p>Helium and Neon concentration duplicates from station 1 of KN199-04 (GT10) cruise. Station, cast, and Niskin bottle numbers are provided along with CTD pressure.</p><p><br />Please note that some US GEOTRACES data may not be final, pending intercalibration results and further analysis. If you are interested in following changes to US GEOTRACES NAT data, there is an RSS feed available via the BCO-DMO <a href="http://www.bco-dmo.org/project/2066">US GEOTRACES project page</a> (scroll down and expand the "Datasets" section).</p> Acquisition Description: <p><strong>Sampling Description:</strong><br />Helium isotope, and helium and neon concentrations were measured on samples drawn from Niskin bottles via tygon tubing and stored in crimped 5/8" copper tubing using the technique described by Young and Lupton (Young and Lupton, 1983).</p><p><strong>Sample Processing:</strong><br />The gas samples were quantitatively extracted on shore using a water vapor extraction method into 25 ml aluminosilicate glass ampoules (Lott and Jenkins, 1998).</p><p><strong>Sample Analysis:</strong><br />Helium isotopes, helium and neon concentrations were measured using an automated magnetic sector-QMS system with cryogenic separation methods described elsewhere (Lott, 2001; Lott and Jenkins, 1984, 1998). Helium isotope measurements were made mass spectrometrically referenced to marine air to an accuracy of 0.15% or better, and corrected for instrumental non-linearity (dependence of isotope ratio determination on sample size). Helium and neon concentrations were determined by peak-height manometry against a calibrated marine air standard. Helium was measured to 0.3% and neon was determined to 0.55%. All uncertainties were confirmed by replicate analyses of water samples and standards.</p><p><strong>References:</strong><br /><strong>Lott,</strong> D.E., 2001. Improvements in noble gas separation methodology: a nude cryogenic trap. Geochemistry, Geophysics, Geosystems 2, 10.129/2001GC000202.<br /><strong>Lott</strong>, D.E., Jenkins, W.J., 1984. An automated cryogenic charcoal trap system for helium isotope mass spectrometry. Review of Scientific Instruments 55, 1982-1988. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1063/1.1137692" target="_blank">10.1063/1.1137692</a><br /><strong>Lott</strong>, D.E., Jenkins, W.J., 1998. Advances in the analysis and shipboard processing of tritium and helium samples. International WOCE Newsletter 30, 27-30.<br /><strong>Weiss</strong>, R.F., 1971. Solubility of helium and neon in water and seawater. Journal of Chemical Engineering Data 16, 235-241.<br /><strong>Young,</strong> C., Lupton, J.E., 1983. An ultratight fluid sampling system using cold-welded copper tubing. EOS Transactions AGU 64, 735.</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-0926659 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=0926659

gmd:keyword.gmx:Anchor: salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31445.rdf Name: station_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'station', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31446.rdf Name: cast_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Cast identifier, numbered consecutively within a station. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'stacast', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31447.rdf Name: sample_bottle_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; rangies from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'bottle', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31448.rdf Name: press Units: dbar Description: Pressure from CTD. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31449.rdf Name: He Units: nmol/kg Description: Concentration of dissolved helium (He) per kg of water measured by mass spectrometry. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31450.rdf Name: Ne Units: nmol/kg Description: Concentration of dissolved neon (Ne) per kg of water measured by mass spectrometry. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31451.rdf Name: delta_3He Units: % Description: Helium isotope ratio anomaly. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31452.rdf Name: delta_He Units: % Description: Gas Saturation Anomaly expressed in percent. Defined as:delta_He = (C(He)/C*(He)-1)*100%where C(He) is the concentration of helium in seawater (as reported) in units of nmol/kg, and C*(He) is the solubility concentration in the same for helium at the potential temperature and salinityof the water computed from the solubility relations measured in the laboratory by Weiss (1971). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31453.rdf Name: delta_Ne Units: % Description: Gas Saturation Anomaly expressed in percent. Defined as:delta_Ne = (C(Ne)/C*(Ne)-1)*100%where C(Ne) is the concentration of neon in seawater (as reported) in units of nmol/kg, and C*(Ne) is the solubility concentration in the same for neon at the potential temperature and salinityof the water computed from the solubility relations measured in the laboratory by Weiss (1971). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31454.rdf Name: temp Units: degrees C Description: Temperature. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31455.rdf Name: sal Units: PSU Description: Salinity. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31456.rdf Name: delta_3He_sd Units: % Description: Standard deviation (sigma) of delta_3He. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31457.rdf Name: delta_He_sd Units: % Description: Standard deviation (sigma) of delta_He. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31458.rdf Name: delta_Ne_sd Units: % Description: Standard deviation (sigma) of delta_Ne. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32131.rdf Name: cruise_id Units: text Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32809.rdf Name: lat_nom Units: decimal degrees Description: Nominal latitude of station. Obtained from KN199-04 station waypoints provided by Chief Sci. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32810.rdf Name: lon_nom Units: decimal degrees Description: Nominal longitude of station. Obtained from KN199-04 station waypoints provided by Chief Sci. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33143.rdf Name: event_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33144.rdf Name: depth_GEOTRC_CTD Units: meters Description: Observation/sample depth in meters, calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33145.rdf Name: sample_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33146.rdf Name: bottle_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g., NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33147.rdf Name: BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.xx][+/-TZ] Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/PRESPR01/ Name: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/HEXC/ Name: Dissolved noble gas concentration parameters in the water column Description: All concentration parameters including saturations and statistics such as standard deviations http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/HEXC/ Name: Dissolved noble gas concentration parameters in the water column Description: All concentration parameters including saturations and statistics such as standard deviations http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/HEXC/ Name: Dissolved noble gas concentration parameters in the water column Description: All concentration parameters including saturations and statistics such as standard deviations http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/HEXC/ Name: Dissolved noble gas concentration parameters in the water column Description: All concentration parameters including saturations and statistics such as standard deviations http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/TEMPP901/ Name: Temperature (ITS-90) of the water body Description: The degree of hotness at any position within a volume of fresh or salt water expressed against the International Temperature Scale 1990 (ITS-90) calibration standard. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/PSALST01/ Name: Practical salinity of the water body by CTD and computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm Description: This is the preferred term for this definition. Alternative term PSALST02 is included to cover cases where there are two sensors of the same type contributing to the data set and referential integrity considerations prevent a usage of a single code. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'station', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Cast identifier, numbered consecutively within a station. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'stacast', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; rangies from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'bottle', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: Niskin sample bottle number

gmd:sequenceIdentifier.xlink:title: salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Practical salinity of the water body by CTD and computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Salinity.; General Description: salinity, calculated from the CTD 'primary sensors' of conductivity and temperature, Practical Salinity Scale (PSS-78), dimensionless. Depending on the input source, salinity from the primary sensors can have a variety of names i.e. s0, s00, sal0, sal00. NERC Description: This is the preferred term for this definition. Alternative term PSALST02 is included to cover cases where there are two sensors of the same type contributing to the data set and referential integrity considerations prevent a usage of a single code.
PI-supplied Description: Standard deviation (sigma) of delta_3He.; General Description: Generic standard deviation value, taking on the units of the parameter that it is tied to.
PI-supplied Description: Standard deviation (sigma) of delta_He.; General Description: Generic standard deviation value, taking on the units of the parameter that it is tied to.
PI-supplied Description: Standard deviation (sigma) of delta_Ne.; General Description: Generic standard deviation value, taking on the units of the parameter that it is tied to.
PI-supplied Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04.; General Description: cruise designation; name
PI-supplied Description: Nominal latitude of station. Obtained from KN199-04 station waypoints provided by Chief Sci.; General Description: nominal latitude; negative denotes South
PI-supplied Description: Nominal longitude of station. Obtained from KN199-04 station waypoints provided by Chief Sci.; General Description: nominal longitude; negative denotes West

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Observation/sample depth in meters, calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g., NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p><strong>Sampling Description:</strong><br />Helium isotope, and helium and neon concentrations were measured on samples drawn from Niskin bottles via tygon tubing and stored in crimped 5/8" copper tubing using the technique described by Young and Lupton (Young and Lupton, 1983).</p><p><strong>Sample Processing:</strong><br />The gas samples were quantitatively extracted on shore using a water vapor extraction method into 25 ml aluminosilicate glass ampoules (Lott and Jenkins, 1998).</p><p><strong>Sample Analysis:</strong><br />Helium isotopes, helium and neon concentrations were measured using an automated magnetic sector-QMS system with cryogenic separation methods described elsewhere (Lott, 2001; Lott and Jenkins, 1984, 1998). Helium isotope measurements were made mass spectrometrically referenced to marine air to an accuracy of 0.15% or better, and corrected for instrumental non-linearity (dependence of isotope ratio determination on sample size). Helium and neon concentrations were determined by peak-height manometry against a calibrated marine air standard. Helium was measured to 0.3% and neon was determined to 0.55%. All uncertainties were confirmed by replicate analyses of water samples and standards.</p><p><strong>References:</strong><br /><strong>Lott,</strong> D.E., 2001. Improvements in noble gas separation methodology: a nude cryogenic trap. Geochemistry, Geophysics, Geosystems 2, 10.129/2001GC000202.<br /><strong>Lott</strong>, D.E., Jenkins, W.J., 1984. An automated cryogenic charcoal trap system for helium isotope mass spectrometry. Review of Scientific Instruments 55, 1982-1988. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1063/1.1137692" target="_blank">10.1063/1.1137692</a><br /><strong>Lott</strong>, D.E., Jenkins, W.J., 1998. Advances in the analysis and shipboard processing of tritium and helium samples. International WOCE Newsletter 30, 27-30.<br /><strong>Weiss</strong>, R.F., 1971. Solubility of helium and neon in water and seawater. Journal of Chemical Engineering Data 16, 235-241.<br /><strong>Young,</strong> C., Lupton, J.E., 1983. An ultratight fluid sampling system using cold-welded copper tubing. EOS Transactions AGU 64, 735.</p>

<p>Parameter names were modified to conform with BCO-DMO naming conventions.</p><p>lat_nom and lon_nom were added by BCO-DMO from station waypoints provided by the Chief Scientist of cruise KN199-04.</p><p><strong>Additional GEOTRACES Processing:</strong><br />After the data were submitted to the International Data Management Office, BODC, the office noticed that important identifying information was missing in many datasets. With the agreement of BODC and the US GEOTRACES lead PIs, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters: station_GEOTRC, cast_GEOTRC (bottle and pump data only), event_GEOTRC, sample_GEOTRC, sample_bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD_rounded (bottle data only), BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC (bottle data only), and GeoFish_id (GeoFish data only). This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter comparison of the datasets.<br /><br />Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle_GT10, GT-C_Bottle_GT11, ODF_Bottle_GT10, and ODF_Bottle_GT11 datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the Event_Log_GT10 and Event_Log_GT11 datasets. McLane pump cast numbers missing in event logs were taken from the Particulate Th-234 dataset submitted by Ken Buesseler.<br /><br />A standardized BCO-DMO method (called "join") was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters.<br /><br />If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the names of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.<br /><br />See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: Niskin bottle Instrument Name: Niskin bottle Instrument Short Name:Niskin bottle Instrument Description: A Niskin bottle (a next generation water sampler based on the Nansen bottle) is a cylindrical, non-metallic water collection device with stoppers at both ends. The bottles can be attached individually on a hydrowire or deployed in 12, 24 or 36 bottle Rosette systems mounted on a frame and combined with a CTD. Niskin bottles are used to collect discrete water samples for a range of measurements including pigments, nutrients, plankton, etc. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL0412/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Mass Spectrometer PI Supplied Instrument Description:The mass spectrometer used for measurement was known as 'MS1'. This is a custom-built instrument located at the Isotope Geochemistry Facility (IGF) at Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (WHOI). The MS1 is a 10-inch radius, 90-degree magnetic sector instrument dedicated to the measurement of tritium, helium, and neon in seawater and groundwater samples. For a full description, see http://www.whoi.edu/sbl/liteSite.do?litesiteid=28952&articleId=47708 Instrument Name: Mass Spectrometer Instrument Short Name:Mass Spec Instrument Description: General term for instruments used to measure the mass-to-charge ratio of ions; generally used to find the composition of a sample by generating a mass spectrum representing the masses of sample components. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/LAB16/

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
